summary: This bill, the Sarah Debbink Langenkamp Active Transportation Safety Act, amends Title 23 of the United States Code regarding the highway safety improvement program. It focuses on improving safety for bicyclists and pedestrians. The bill allows for up to 100% federal funding for projects connecting existing bicycle or pedestrian infrastructure and projects reducing safety risks to vulnerable road users. It also modifies flexible financing options and allows specific safety plans to be used to credit funds towards non-federal shares. The bill introduces an increased federal share for proven safety countermeasures for bicyclists and pedestrians.
